programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: Former policeman Robert and his wife Katy gave up their city lives after a witness in his care was shot dead, and he's been struggling with his guilt ever since. In an attempt to put the past behind them, the couple now run a guest house in the Lake District. But when old colleague DCI Mark Maxwell suggests the building would work as a safe house, Robert takes in a family whose members are under threat. It's a chance for him to make use of his detective skills and ensure nothing goes wrong this time. Drama, starring Christopher Eccleston, Marsha Thomason and Paterson Joseph.(n)

programme.title: Safe House

As David, the father, continues to face questions from Robert, can he explain the large amounts of cash passing through his bank account?.(n)

When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. programme.title: Damo & Ivor

programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls fight to be crowned Best Amateur Baker in Ireland. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ireland's Midwives
programme.desc: A woman opts for a home birth as she awaits the arrival of her second child, while another seeks her doctor's approval for a Caesarean section. Plus, the mother of a premature baby hopes her daughter will soon be able to leave intensive care and settle into her new home.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine featuring a weekly round-up of health issues, entertainment news and personalities making the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Strictly Irish Dancing
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following competitors from Ireland, England and America as they prepare for the 2011 World Irish Dancing Championships, held in Dublin for the first time in 15 years. Includes interviews with Michael Flatley, Brendan de Gallai, Ronan McCormack and Karl Drake, plus those who make dresses and wigs for the dancers.(n)

programme.title: Adoption Stories
programme.desc: The documentary features Geraldine, who was told her real mother had died but was introduced to the rest of her family. But there was a sting in the tail when the adoption agency revealed they not searched properly. Plus, the story of Sheila, who was sent to the US for adoption in the early 1960s, and still has the small case containing all her personal belongings that was sent with her. Although she was devoted to her adoptive parents, she has since spent a lot of time in Ireland with her extended family.(n)

programme.title: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: As the arrival of the all-important copper pot stills looms, Jack and Stephen Teeling try to hold all the other aspects of building a whiskey distillery together. Security risks and bad weather are just some of the obstacles faced by the brothers in the run-up to this vital delivery.(n)

programme.title: Stuart's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Stuart O'Keeffe prepares a dinner party, with dishes including a buffet of asparagus and Camembert cheese wrapped with prosciutto, tomato and goat's cheese cream bruschetta with herb oil, and a caramelised banana sundae. He does not believe a host should cook alone, and gets his guests to help in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Stuart's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef advocates a filling meal after a stressful day or hard workout, so he prepares a grilled cheese and sirloin steak sandwich, spaghetti with mushy peas, roast tomato and garlic soup, and Irish sausages and ricotta cheese. Plus, he puts together chewy pecan bars - one of his favourite snacks. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Furry Vengeance
programme.desc: A real estate developer believes he has hit upon a winning idea when he proposes a new housing project on the site of a forested area. However, his plan faces stern protests from a host of woodland creatures eager to protect their homes. Family comedy, starring Brendan Fraser, Brooke Shields and Ken Jeong.(n)

programme.title: The Chase

However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts.(n)

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield presents as two more contestants - call centre manager Jamie from Edinburgh and project engineer Dean from Cardiff - are asked to complete tasks within the confines of a large transparent cube in a bid to win a £250,000 jackpot. Each player has nine lives and must complete up to seven challenges, ranging from agility tests to skill trials. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Big Star's Little Star
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is joined by three celebrity contestants and their children, who will tell revealing stories about their home life in the hope of winning £15,000 for charity. Squirming uncomfortably for the jackpot are musician-turned-cheesemaker Alex James with his twin boys Artie and Gally, TV presenter Michaela Strachan and her son Oliver, and chef Aldo Zilli with his daughter Twiggy.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Squares
programme.desc: Legendary entertainer Dame Edna Everage, Emmerdale's Lucy Pargeter (Chas Dingle), comedians Patrick Monahan and Rufus Hound, Britain's Got Talent 2012 winners Ashleigh and Pudsey, TV presenter Carol Vorderman and comedienne Roisin Conaty join Tim Vine and Joe Wilkinson in the grid, as contestants take on the Noughts-and-Crosses-style challenge. The participants have to say whether they agree or disagree with the general-knowledge answers given by the famous faces inside each box. If they are correct they claim that square, and the first to get three in a line wins the round and the money. One person then goes on to play for the star prize. Warwick Davis hosts the revived game show.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase

programme.desc: The musician talks frankly about his life - including his family, alcohol, how the death of band member Tom Dunphy had a devastating effect on him. programme.title: Laochra Gael - Na Coimhlinti
programme.desc: A look at the football clashes between Galway and Roscommon in 1998 and 2001, a period in which Galway were reaping success in the All-Ireland Finals, but Roscommon were proving to be a thorn in their side. With contributions from Jon O'Mahoney, Ray Silke, Nigel Dineen and John Tobin.(n)

programme.title: Feirm
programme.desc: Farmer Jamie Costin meets people involved in the Irish forestry industry to discover what is happening in the sector. He reveals how Ireland is part of an international accord to keep carbon emissions at an agreed level, and discovers how innovations in the way trees are grown and processed for timber is helping to reduce the country's carbon footprint. He also meets Liam Beechinor to learn about a new innovative project in agro-forestry.(n)

programme.desc: Irish poet Gearoid Mac Lochlainn and Lithuanian theatre director Albertas Vidziunas retrace the steps of a gang of 19th-century book-smugglers who defied the oppressive Russian regime to save the Lithuanian language from extinction. The pair compare the parallel histories of their native tongues, and explore the relationship between language and identity.(n)

Meanwhile, Katrine vows to remain dedicated to her work in spite of her personal problems, while Kasper struggles to stay in control of his life. Danish political drama, starring Sidse Babett Knudsen.(n)
